metadata.synopsis: An actress (Margaret Sullavan) and a writer (Henry Fonda) hide their careers until their New Hampshire honeymoon.

reviews: This picture is lively and amusing most of the time, and, owing to the charm and intelligence of the two stars.
I hate to trot out this idea -- it's too close to the moronic 'they don't make 'em like they used to' -- but this is the type of film it would be hard to put together today.
